statement.tex: \text{A dealer in rural area wishes to purchase}\\ \text{a number of sewing machines. He has only }\\ \text{₹ 5760 to invest and has space for atmost}\\ \text{20 items for storage. An electronic sewing}\\ \text{costs him ₹ 360 and a manually operated}\\ \text{sewing machine ₹ 240. He can see an electronic}\\ \text{sewing machine at a profit of ₹ 22 and a}\\ \text{manually operated machine at a profit of ₹ 18.}\\ \text{Assuming he can sell all the machines that }\\ \text{he can buy, how should he invest his money}\\ \text{in order to maximize his profit?}\\ \textbf{Make it as a LPP and solve it graphically.}

step.reason: \text{The dealer has certain constraints, as shown}\\ \text{in the table below} \\ (\textbf{e = }\text{electronic m/c, }\textbf{m = }\text{ manual m/c.})\\ \begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|} \hline \text{Type} & \text{Constraint} & \text{Line} \\ \hline \text{Budgetary} & 360e + 240m\leq 5760 & 3e + 2m = 48 \\ \text{Storage} & e + m \leq 20 & e + m = 20 \\ \hline \end{tabular} \\ \underline{\text{Spot Check}} \\ \begin{align} e + m &= 20 \implies e = 20-m \\ 3e + 2m &= 48 \implies e = 16 - \frac{2}{3}m \end{align} \\ \text{The line with the higher y-intercept should}\\ \text{therefore be }e + m = 20\text{ - which happens}\\ \text{to be the storage constraint line.}

\text{Any feasible region will have to satisfy}\\ \text{the following two conditions }\textbf{simultaneously.}\\ \quad\bullet\, \text{be below }e + m = 20 \\ \quad\bullet\, \text{be below }3e + 2m = 48 \\

step.context: \text{The dealer thinks he knows what the maximum}\\ \text{profit he can make is. And he tells you that}\\ \text{it is the number below.}\\ \textbf{Has the dealer calculated his profit correctly?}
step.reason: \text{The dealer's objective is to maximize} \\ \quad P = 22e + 18m \\ \text{And given the feasible region from Step 2, we} \\ \text{have the following points to consider}\\ \begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|} \hline \text{Point} & (m,e) & \text{Profit} \\ \hline B & (0,16) & 16\times ₹22 = ₹ 352\\ C & (12,8) & 12\times ₹ 18 + 8\times ₹ 22 = ₹ 392\\ D & (20,0) & 20\times ₹ 18 = ₹ 360 \\ \hline \end{tabular} \\ \text{Hence, the dealer's maximum profit would be}\\ \text{when he sells 12 manual and 8 electronic sewing}\\ \text{machines for a total profit of ₹ 392.}
